definition: to lift sth up/to elevate sb/to honor sb (with compliments, gifts, promotions etc)/to show great regard/to speak highly/Taiwan pr. [tai2 ju3]
to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
variant of 舉|举[ju3]
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors

sentences.english: Some reports called it “militaristic”, but that is too flattering.
sentences.chinese: 有些报道称它为“军国主义的”，但那也太抬举它了。

sentences.english: Other-enhancement is a specific strategy of self- handicapping .
sentences.chinese: 抬举他人也是一种特殊形式的自我设限。

sentences.english: You forgive me for raising you up so high.
sentences.chinese: 你原谅我把你抬举的如此之高。

sentences.english: Avoid strenuous physical activity or heavy lifting for about five hours after donation.
sentences.chinese: 献血后五小时避免剧烈动力及抬举重物。

sentences.english: They really make me feel welcome.
sentences.chinese: 他们真地是我有受到抬举的感觉。

sentences.english: He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, and lifteth the needy out of the dunghill;
sentences.chinese: 他从灰尘里抬举贫寒人，从粪堆中提拔穷乏人。

sentences.english: We in America, on the other hand, are very unappreciative buyers.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，我们在美国却是些“不识抬举”的买家。

sentences.english: Objective To study the clinic results of modified sternal elevation operation(MSEO) in management of pectus excavatum(PE).
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨改良胸肋抬举术治疗儿童漏斗胸的临床效果。

definition: to show respect for/to think highly of
lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
to not deserve (one's good fortune etc)
to speak seriously/to exaggerate
modest/self-deprecating
variant of 折殺|折杀[zhe2 sha1]
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors
(idiom) blind as a bat (figuratively)/unaware of who (or what) one is dealing with/to fail to recognize what sb a bit more perceptive would
to attach importance to sth/to value
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
lit. not dare to pull oneself up high (humble term)/I cannot presume on your attention
to regard sb as an outsider
to show no understanding of the times (idiom); cannot adapt to current circumstances/not amenable to reason
to be unworthy to associate with (sb of higher social status)
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
